Linear Algebra.title: CR Decomp: Reconstruction
Linear Algebra.description: We need to verify our matrix compression. You have a Column matrix 'C' and a Row matrix 'R'. Your mission is to reconstruct a specific single cell of the original matrix A at row 'i' and column 'j'. This is done by calculating the dot product of row 'i' from C and column 'j' from R.

roles.architect: Logic: Multiply row i of C by column j of R (scalar logic for 1x1).

Linear Algebra.title: SVD: Diagonal Strength
Linear Algebra.description: Signal noise is corrupting our data. We need a filter for our Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) process. Write a function filter_singular(val, threshold) that checks a singular value. If 'val' is strictly greater than the 'threshold', keep it; otherwise, return 0 to suppress the noise.

roles.translator: Syntax: return val if val > threshold else 0

Linear Algebra.title: Racing: Nitro Boost
Linear Algebra.description: Engage the nitrous oxide system! We need a burst of speed to overtake the target. Write a function activate_nitro(speed) that takes the current speed and returns exactly double that amount using scalar multiplication.

Linear Algebra.title: Physics: Gravity Fall
Linear Algebra.description: The object is in freefall. We need to calculate its next vertical position. Write a function apply_gravity(y_pos, fall_speed) that takes the current vertical position 'y_pos' and subtracts the 'fall_speed' to determine where it will be next frame.

roles.architect: Logic: Subtract fall speed from Y position.

Linear Algebra.title: Nav: Dot Product
Linear Algebra.description: Navigation systems require a dot product calculation to determine vector alignment. You are given two 2D vectors, v1 and v2, each containing an x and y component (e.g., [x, y]). Calculate their dot product using the formula: (v1_x * v2_x) + (v1_y * v2_y).

roles.architect: Logic: Multiply matching components and sum them.

Data Science.title: PCA: Center Data
Data Science.description: The first step of PCA is centering data. Write a function center_point(x, mean) that centers a data point 'x' by subtracting the global 'mean' from it. This shifts the data distribution so its center is at zero.

roles.architect: Logic: Subtract the mean from the data point.

Data Science.title: Data: High Score
Data Science.description: We need to identify the top performer from a dataset. Write a function find_winner(scores) that accepts a list of numerical 'scores' and identifies the highest value among them.

roles.translator: Syntax: return max(scores) or loop logic.

Data Science.title: Inventory: Filter Junk
Data Science.description: Our inventory database is cluttered with low-value items. Write a function sort_valuables(inventory) that takes a list of item values and returns a new list containing *only* the items with a value strictly greater than 10.

roles.architect: Logic: Filter list based on condition.
roles.translator: Syntax: [i for i in inventory if i > 10]

Data Science.title: Social: Username Formatter
Data Science.description: Usernames in our database are inconsistent. We need a standardization protocol. Write a function save_user(username) that takes a raw 'username' string and returns it converted entirely to lowercase letters for storage.

Data Science.title: Stats: Average Value
Data Science.description: We need to analyze the central tendency of our data. Write a function calc_average(numbers) that calculates the arithmetic mean of a list of numbers. Remember, the mean is the sum of all elements divided by the total count of elements.

roles.architect: Logic: Total sum divided by number of items.
roles.debugger: Check: Handle empty list if needed (assume valid input here).

Machine Learning.title: VAE: Reparameterize
Machine Learning.description: In Variational Autoencoders, we need to sample from a latent space to generate new data. Implement the 'reparameterization trick' in the function reparameterize(mu, std, epsilon). It should calculate 'mu + (epsilon * std)', scaling the random noise 'epsilon' by the standard deviation 'std' and shifting it by the mean 'mu'.

roles.architect: Logic: Scale noise by std deviation and shift by mean.

Machine Learning.title: GenAI: Diffusion Noise
Machine Learning.description: We are simulating the forward diffusion process for image generation. Write a function add_noise(img, noise, beta) that takes an original image pixel value 'img', a noise value, and a scaling factor 'beta'. The function should return the new pixel value calculated as 'img + (noise * beta)'.

roles.architect: Logic: Add scaled noise to the image.

Machine Learning.title: Survival: Hunger Check
Machine Learning.description: Survival monitoring systems are active. We need to trigger an alert if the subject is in critical condition. Write a function check_status(hunger, health) that returns True if 'hunger' is greater than 80 OR if 'health' is less than 20. Otherwise, return False.

roles.architect: Logic: Check high hunger or low health.

Machine Learning.title: AI: ReLU Activation
Machine Learning.description: Neural networks need non-linearity to learn complex patterns. Implement the ReLU (Rectified Linear Unit) activation function relu(x). It should return the input 'x' if 'x' is positive, but return 0 if 'x' is negative (effectively max(0, x)).

roles.architect: Logic: Return maximum of x and 0.

Machine Learning.title: Model: Linear Predictor
Machine Learning.description: We are predicting housing costs using a simple linear regression model. The formula for the line is y = mx + c. Write a function predict(m, x, c) that takes the slope 'm', the feature value 'x', and the y-intercept/bias 'c', and calculates the predicted price 'y'.

roles.architect: Logic: Multiply feature by slope and add bias.

Data Structures & Algorithms.title: Stack: Push Operation
Data Structures & Algorithms.description: We are managing a stack of data plates. Implement the 'push' operation in the function push_stack(stack, plate). Add the new 'plate' to the end (top) of the 'stack' list and return the updated stack.

roles.architect: Logic: Add item to the end of the collection (LIFO).

Data Structures & Algorithms.title: Queue: Dequeue
Data Structures & Algorithms.description: A line of processes is waiting for execution. Implement the 'dequeue' operation in dequeue_person(queue). It should remove and return the *first* item from the list 'queue', simulating a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) structure.

roles.architect: Logic: Remove item from the front (FIFO).

Data Structures & Algorithms.title: Algo: Binary Search Step
Data Structures & Algorithms.description: Binary search requires finding the middle element to divide the search space. Write a function find_midpoint(low, high) that takes the 'low' and 'high' pointers. Calculate and return the middle index using integer division (average rounded down).

roles.architect: Logic: Average of low and high, rounded down.

Data Structures & Algorithms.title: Sort: Leaderboard
Data Structures & Algorithms.description: The competition has ended, and we need to rank the participants. Write a function rank_players(times) that takes a list of race times and returns a new list sorted in ascending order (smallest time first).

General Coding.title: RPG: Health Potion
General Coding.description: Your hero has taken damage! You have a standard health potion that restores 20 HP. Write a function drink_potion(current_hp) that takes the 'current_hp' and returns the new health value after adding exactly 20 points.

General Coding.title: Launch Countdown
General Coding.description: T-minus 10 seconds to rocket launch. Write a function get_countdown() that generates and returns a list of integers counting down from 10 to 1 (inclusive), like [10, 9, ..., 1].

General Coding.title: FPS: Reload Mechanic
General Coding.description: The player's weapon is empty. They've initiated a reload sequence. Write a function reload_weapon() that ignores current ammo state and simply returns the integer 30, representing a full magazine.

roles.architect: Logic: Reset value to max capacity (30).

General Coding.title: Puzzle: Score Multiplier
General Coding.description: The level is complete. We need to tally the total score. Write a function calc_score(points, bonus) that takes the base 'points' and the 'bonus' points earned, and returns their sum.

General Coding.title: Inventory: The First Slot
General Coding.description: Quick! The player needs to equip their primary weapon. In this game, the primary weapon is always the first item in the backpack. Write a function equip_primary(backpack) that accepts a list 'backpack' and returns the item at index 0.

roles.architect: Logic: Get the element at index 0.

General Coding.title: Chat: Shout Filter
General Coding.description: Stop the shouting! Users are typing in all caps. Write a function filter_chat(message) that takes a 'message' string and returns it in Title Case (where only the first letter is capitalized, and the rest are lowercase), making it polite.

roles.architect: Logic: Capitalize only the first letter.

General Coding.title: Economy: Gold Loot
General Coding.description: The monster has been defeated. Generate the standard loot drop. Write a function generate_loot() that creates and returns a list containing exactly two strings: 'Gold Coin' and 'Dagger'.

roles.architect: Logic: Create a list with two specific strings.

General Coding.title: Stats: Level Up Cost
General Coding.description: The player has leveled up! We need to calculate the experience points required for the next milestone. Write a function calc_xp(current_level) that takes the 'current_level' and returns the result of multiplying it by 100.

General Coding.title: UI: Welcome Message
General Coding.description: We need to personalize the start screen. Write a function show_intro(player_name) that accepts a 'player_name' string. It should return a greeting string in the format: 'Welcome, ' followed immediately by the player's name.

roles.architect: Logic: Combine static string with input variable.

General Coding.title: Combat: Shield Break
General Coding.description: The shield generator has been hit by an EMP! It must be disabled immediately. Write a function break_shield() that takes no arguments and simply returns the boolean value False.

General Coding.title: Shop: Buy Item
General Coding.description: A transaction is taking place. The player is buying an item. Write a function buy_item(gold, price) that takes the player's current 'gold' and the item's 'price'. Return the remaining gold after subtracting the price.

General Coding.title: Party: Add Member
General Coding.description: A new adventurer wants to join your quest. Write a function recruit_hero(party) that takes your current 'party' list. Append the string 'Rogue' to the end of the list and return the updated party.

General Coding.title: Settings: Volume Up
General Coding.description: The audio is too quiet. Write a function adjust_volume(volume) that takes the current 'volume' level integer and returns it increased by 1.

General Coding.title: Platformer: Double Jump
General Coding.description: We need to limit the player to a double jump mechanic. Write a function check_jump(jump_count) that accepts 'jump_count'. Return True if the player has jumped fewer than 2 times, otherwise return False to prevent further jumps.

General Coding.title: RPG: Critical Hit
General Coding.description: It's a critical hit check! Write a function calculate_crit(roll, damage) that takes a d100 'roll' and the base 'damage'. If the roll is strictly greater than 90, the attack is a critical hit: return triple the damage (damage * 3). Otherwise, return the normal damage.

roles.architect: Logic: If roll > 90, triple damage. Else normal.
roles.translator:
Syntax: if roll > 90:
        return damage * 3
    return damage

General Coding.title: Loot: Rare Drop
General Coding.description: The player is opening a loot box. We need sound effects. Write a function open_chest(item) that accepts an 'item' string. If the item is 'Legendary', return the string 'Fanfare'. For any other item, return 'Click'.

General Coding.title: Crafting: Make Sword
General Coding.description: The player is at the forge attempting to craft a sword. This recipe requires at least 2 Iron and 1 Wood. Write a function try_craft(iron, wood) that takes 'iron' and 'wood' counts. Return True if both requirements are met, otherwise False.

General Coding.title: Inventory: Backpack Limit
General Coding.description: The player is trying to pick up an item, but we must check if their bag is full. Write a function check_capacity(items, max_slots) that accepts a list of 'items' and a 'max_slots' integer. Return True if the number of items is greater than or equal to the max slots (meaning it's full), otherwise False.

roles.architect: Logic: Check if list length exceeds limit.

General Coding.title: FPS: Auto-Reload
General Coding.description: The HUD needs to display ammo status. Write a function check_ammo(ammo) that accepts an integer 'ammo'. Return 'Reload' if ammo is exactly 0. Return 'Low' if ammo is between 1 and 4 (less than 5). Otherwise, return 'OK'.

General Coding.title: Race: Lap Counter
General Coding.description: The car is crossing the finish line. Write a function cross_line(laps) that takes the current 'laps' count. First, add 1 to the laps. Then, check the new count: if it equals 3, return 'Finish'. Otherwise, return 'Continue'.

General Coding.title: Cards: Deck Builder
General Coding.description: In this card game, holding an Ace is dangerous. Write a function play_card(hand) that accepts a list 'hand'. If the string 'Ace' is in the hand, remove it. Finally, return the modified hand.

General Coding.title: Login: Password Reset
General Coding.description: A user has requested a password reset. Write a function reset_pass(email, database) that takes an 'email' and a 'database' list. If the email exists inside the database list, return 'Sent'. If not found, return 'Unknown'.

roles.translator: Syntax: return 'Sent' if email in database else 'Unknown'

General Coding.title: Puzzle: Sequence
General Coding.description: We have intercepted a coded message, but only the suffix matters. Write a function decode(secret_code) that accepts a string 'secret_code'. Extract and return the last 3 characters of that string.

General Coding.title: Shop: Discount
General Coding.description: It's a sale! Write a function apply_coupon(price) that takes an item's 'price'. Calculate the new price by applying a 10% discount (multiplying by 0.9) and return the result.

General Coding.title: Music: Playlist Loop
General Coding.description: The playlist has reached the end. We need to loop back to the first song. Write a function loop_music() that ignores inputs and simply returns the integer 0, representing the index of the first track.

General Coding.title: Settings: Dark Mode
General Coding.description: The user is toggling the UI theme. Write a function toggle_theme(theme) that accepts the current 'theme' string. If it is 'Light', return 'Dark'. Otherwise, return 'Light'.
